oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Authenic Cowboy Songs with Lorne Green - October 1967
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview with Lorene Greene (musician) and hosted by Hugh Cherry (entertainer). The segment is for the Authentic Cowboy Songs radio show. The recording is from October of 1967.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lorne Green
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:03) Hugh Cherry introduces the program -- (00:07) Unidentified tune [featuring Hugh Cherry introducing Lorne Greene] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:25) Bonanza Theme Song (Jay Livingston and Ray Evans) -- (02:57) Cherry introduces Greene, and both reflect on the story behind "The Old Chisolm Trail" -- (05:35) The Old Chisolm Trail (Mac McClintock) -- (09:03) Cherry invites Greene to reflect on the international heritage of western music, and Greene discusses "Cowboy's Dream" -- (11:28) Cowboy's Dream (Jules Allen) -- (14:48) Cherry and Greene joke about Greene impersonating artists; additionally, Greene reflects on 's recollection of the buffalo hunters -- (19:59) Buffalo Skinners (Ed McCurdy) -- (26:03) Cherry reintroduces Greene and Cherry asks Greene to reflect on 'bad men' like Jesse James-- (31:27) Jesse James (Bentley Ball) (Unconfirmed) -- (36:00) Cherry and Greene reflect on the longevity of "Jesse James," and Cherry asks why Greene recorded "Cool Water" -- (37:31) Cool Water (Lorne Greene) -- (40:15) Cherry and Greene discuss the sensation of a well performed scene; additionally, both praise Tex Ritter's body of work -- (43:28) High Noon (Tex Ritter) -- (46:11) Cherry asks Greene about his favorite western tunes -- (47:08) El Paso (Marty Robbins) -- (51:45) Cherry praises Greene as both say their goodbyes -- (53:19) Unidentified tune [featuring Hugh Cherry commercial voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Green, Lorne; Cherry, Hugh;
